newsitem.title: USA: White House sees "fruitful" capital gains talks.
newsitem.headline: White House sees "fruitful" capital gains talks.

text.p: The White House Thursday said it forsees "fruitful dialogue" with Congress on ways to develop specific targeted capital gains tax cuts.

White House Press Secretary Mike McCurry, discussing various proposals to target capital gains tax cuts for specific groups, such as farmers or small businesses, said President Clinton was open to discussing such ideas with Congress.
"There will be areas for fruitful dialogue on targeted capital gains," McCurry said, noting that Clinton has backed the principle in the past.
